intro: Styphelia australis, commonly known as the Australian heath, is a low-growing evergreen shrub native to the southern regions of Australia. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes many shrubs and small trees adapted to acidic soils. The plant features dense clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white, blooming in spring. Its foliage consists of narrow, leathery leaves that are arranged in whorls around the stems. Styphelia australis is well-suited to coastal and sandy environments, often found in heathlands and coastal dunes.
